properties.conditionHint.description: Validation error message that a Toloker will see
properties.data.description: Data with values that will be processed or changed.
properties.direction.description:
Defines the direction of the list:

* `vertical` (default) — Vertical list.
* `horizontal` — Horizontal list.
properties.fullHeight.description: If `true`, the element takes up all the vertical free space. The element is set to a minimum height of 400 pixels.
properties.maxWidth.description: Maximum width of the element in pixels, must be greater than `minWidth`.
properties.minWidth.description: Minimum width of the element in pixels. Takes priority over `maxWidth`.
properties.preserveFalse.description: Property that specifies whether to return `false` values in the results. By default, if the component returns `false`, this result will not be added to the output. To add `false` to the results, specify `"preserveFalse": true`.
properties.ratio.description:
An array of two numbers that sets the relative dimensions of the sides: width (first number) to height (second number).

Not valid if `"fullHeight": true`.
properties.rtl.description:
In some languages, like Arabic or Hebrew, text is written from right to left. Use this property to set up the correct display mode for the component.

[View example in the sandbox](https://ya.cc/t/tq6fCNm_3ttFBW).

[Learn more about RTL languages](https://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-scripts).
properties.rtl.properties.mode.descripti:
Display mode:
* `ltr` — left to right.
* `rtl` — right to left.

The chosen value will be added to the `dir` attribute in the component's HTML code. [Learn more about dir](https://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-html-dir).
properties.size.description: Specifies the size of the margins between elements. Acceptable values in ascending order: `s`, `m` (default value).
